page.title: 18DONALDSON'S SCHOOL EDINBURGH
page.content: Since{1939}the school ,opened in{1852, has been solely for deaf pupils.In 1959 a new school was opened behind the {PLAYFAIR}building, consisting of 14 classrooms, Home Economics,Computer and Technical Depts.,an Art Studio and a Swimming Pool.In 1985 there are 66 {profoundly deaf }pupils, the 1852 school was built to accomodate 300 pupils.The method of{COMMUNICATION} used is{TOTAL COMMUNICATION.} Within the 17 acre grounds are foxes squirrels and rabbits and a great variety of trees, many planted for the {FIRST}ever{Forestry Exhibition of 1884 visited by the{PRINCE}and{PRINCESS}of {WALES.}In Summer,{SWIFTS}are seen and in Autumn{FIELDFARES}and{REDWINGS}pass through.A{KESTREL} nests in the school clock tower. In 1984 2.3 acres of land was given to E.D.C. to be incorporated in the{WATER OF LEITH WALKWAY.}
